connector.description: To securely manage users on Huawei Cloud

camel.source.endpoint.authenticationKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.authenticationKey
camel.source.endpoint.authenticationKey.description: Authentication key for the cloud user

camel.source.endpoint.endpoint.name: camel.source.endpoint.endpoint
camel.source.endpoint.endpoint.description: IAM endpoint url. Carries higher precedence than region parameter based client initialization

camel.source.endpoint.groupId.name: camel.source.endpoint.groupId
camel.source.endpoint.groupId.description: Group ID to perform operation with

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: IAM service region. This is lower precedence than endpoint based configuration

camel.source.endpoint.secretKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.secretKey
camel.source.endpoint.secretKey.description: Secret key for the cloud user

camel.source.endpoint.serviceKeys.name: camel.source.endpoint.serviceKeys
camel.source.endpoint.serviceKeys.description: Configuration object for cloud service authentication

camel.source.endpoint.userId.name: camel.source.endpoint.userId
camel.source.endpoint.userId.description: User ID to perform operation with

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.hwcloud-iam.bridgeErrorH.name: camel.component.hwcloud-iam.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.hwcloud-iam.bridgeErrorH.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.hwcloud-iam.autowiredEna.name: camel.component.hwcloud-iam.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.hwcloud-iam.autowiredEna.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
